e:AD-2.21.e:Title: NOISE ABATEMENT PROVISIONS
e:AD-2.21.x:p: The published Standard Instrument Departure (SID) routes are part of the noise abetment procedures, Therefore strict adherence is compulsory for all IFR flights, except light propeller aircraft until passing 7000 FT QNH.

e:Sub-section.e:Title: Procedures for flights during operation of air traffic control (ATC)
GENERAL
e:Sub-section.x:p: Flights departing from Sármellék Airport, shall request enroute clearance before take off from the Aerodrome Control Service (further on Tower).The enroute clearance will be delivered by the Tower in standard circumstances after giving the start-up clearance on the parking stand.
Departing aircraft have to follow the procedures included in enroute clearance given before the take-off clearance.

e:Sub-section.e:Title: Taxiing
e:Sub-section.x:p: Taxiing shall be carried out as instructed by Tower.

e:Sub-section.e:Title: IFR FLIGHTS
e:Sub-section.x:p: Maximum speed for IFR operation is 250 kt (460 km/h) IAS.

e:Sub-section.e:Title: Standard Instrument Departure (SID)
e:Sub-section.x:p: Tower will use one of the Standard Instrument Departures published for IFR flights.
The departure procedures in use are based on those contained in ICAO Doc 8168 OPS/611 (PANS OPS).

e:Sub-section.e:Title: Instrument approach procedures
e:Sub-section.x:p: The instrument approach procedures are published on Instrument Approach Charts in part AD 2-LHSM.

e:Sub-section.e:Title: Visual approach
e:Sub-section.x:p: A visual approach will only be allowed or offered if the visibility is at least 5 km and the cloud-base at least 1500 ft (450m).

e:Sub-section.e:Title: VFR FLIGHTS
e:Sub-section.x:p: ATC clearance for VFR flights within Sármellék CTA and in CTR will be given on the following conditions:

x:ol.x:li: Flight plan has to be submitted for request of ATC clearance, containing the items 7 to 18 inclusive;
ATC clearance shall be obtained before the aircraft enters the areas concerned.
Position reports shall be submitted in accordance within 3.6.3 of ICAO Annex 2.
Deviation from the ATC clearance may only be made, if prior permission has been obtained;
The flight shall be conducted with vertical visual reference to the ground;
wo-way radio communication shall be maintained with Sármellék Tower on the frequency prescribed
The aircraft shall be equipped with SSR transponder with 4096 codes in mode A/C.

e:Sub-section.e:Title: Procedures for VFR flights within Sármellék CTR
e:Sub-section.x:p: Traffic Pattern:

x:ul.x:li: Left hand traffic pattern for RWY 34
Right hand traffic pattern for RWY 16

e:Sub-section.e:Title: Designated VFR reporting points for entry and exit to/from Sármellék CTR:

x:ul.x:li:
BALATON:
46 42 22, 485 N; 017 15 52, 785 E
(influx of river Zala)

DIOSKAL:
46 39 37, 458 N; 017 03 45, 026 E
(Meteorological Radar Antenna/ approx. 0,8 NM South East of Dioskál village)

e:Sub-section.x:p: Unless otherwise instructed VFR flights approaching from uncontrolled airspace are required to enter CTR via the designated reporting points.
Holding procedure has to be carried out by the instruction of ATC over the designated reporting points or other point identifiable by the pilot.

x:ul.x:li:
Arriving aircraft:
Proceed as cleared. If no landing clearance has been received, hold over the designated entry point of the CTR at 2000’ (600 m) AMSL or below for 5 minutes and then make landing on the designated landing area.

Departing aircraft:
Do not take-off, if communication failure experienced before take-off. Return to parking position.

e:Sub-section.e:Title: Procedures for flights during the operation of aerodrome flight information service (AFIS)
Departing aircraft
e:Sub-section.x:p: The IFR flights entering controlled airspace after departure, shall obtain enroute clearance before take off.
In standard circumstances the enroute clearance will be delivered by AFIS on the parking stand after start-up.
Departing aircraft have to follow the procedures included in enroute clearance given before the take-off.

e:Sub-section.e:Title: Standard Instrument Departure (SID)
e:Sub-section.x:p: Standard Instrument Departures are published in part AD 2-LHSM.
The departure procedures in use are based on those contained in ICAO Doc 8168 OPS/611 (PANS OPS).

e:Sub-section.e:Title: Instrument approach procedures
e:Sub-section.x:p: The instrument approach procedures are published on Instrument Approach Charts in part AD 2-LHSM.

e:Sub-section.e:Title: Arrival
e:Sub-section.x:p: Contact shall be established with AFIS prior to reaching the area boundary;
AFIS provides information about aerodrome local traffic, „Traffic circuit” available as well as conditions of approach and landing.
Traffic Pattern:

x:ul.x:li: Left hand traffic pattern for RWY 34
Right hand traffic pattern for RWY 16

e:Sub-section.x:p: Designated VFR reporting points:

x:ul.x:li:
BALATON:
46 42 22, 485 N; 017 15 52, 785 E
(influx of river Zala)

DIOSKAL:
46 39 37, 458 N; 017 03 45, 026 E
(Meteorological Radar Antenna/ approx. 0,8 NM South East of Dioskál village)

e:Sub-section.x:p: When instrument approach is in progress all VFR aircraft operating within the TIZ will be advised to land or hold outside Sármellék TIZ.

e:Sub-section.e:Title: Operation of aircraft types
e:Sub-section.x:p: Only on workdays between 0800-1600 LT, on work-off days and holidays not authorized.
Maximum two flights with aircraft type IL76 or IL62 daily, furthermore in every 14 days one IL86.
Flights are subject to pay 15% noise surcharge over the standard landing fee.
